alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Nuckolls; Webster (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 17 at 4:13AM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Jewell, northeastern Smith, southwestern Nuckolls, southern Franklin and Webster Counties through 445 AM CDT... At 413 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Franklin to 7 miles north of Bellaire to near Esbon. Movement was northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and hail to mainly one-half inch. However, isolated pockets of slightly larger hail to around penny size are possible. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Superior, Red Cloud, Franklin, Mankato, Campbell, Guide Rock, Lebanon, Burr Oak, Bloomington, Esbon, Riverton, Cowles, Webber, Inavale, Lovewell State Park and Bostwick. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
